question: Match the following:
columnB: Mostly marine and photosynthetic
Has stiff cellulose plates on the outer surface
One lies longitudinally and the other transversely in a furrow
Caused by rapid multiplication of red dinoflagellates
Example of red dinoflagellate

answer.Dinoflagellate cell wall: Has stiff cellulose plates on the outer surface
answer.Dinoflagellate flagella: One lies longitudinally and the other transversely in a furrow
answer.Red tides: Caused by rapid multiplication of red dinoflagellates

question: Match the following:
columnB: May even kill other marine animals such as fishes
Majority are fresh water organisms found in stagnant water
Have a protein rich layer called pellicle
Two flagella: a short and a long one
Example: Euglena

answer.Toxins released during red tides: May even kill other marine animals such as fishes
answer.Euglenoid habitat: Majority are fresh water organisms found in stagnant water
answer.Euglenoid body covering: Have a protein rich layer called pellicle
answer.Euglenoid flagella: Two flagella: a short and a long one

question: Match the following:
columnB: Photosynthetic
Behave like heterotrophs by predating on other smaller organisms
Identical to those present in higher plants
Saprophytic protists
Aggregation that may grow and spread over several feet

answer.Euglenoid nutrition in dark: Behave like heterotrophs by predating on other smaller organisms
answer.Euglenoid pigments: Identical to those present in higher plants
answer.Plasmodium (slime mould): Aggregation that may grow and spread over several feet

question: Match the following:
columnB: Differentiate and form fruiting bodies bearing spores at their tips
Extremely resistant and survive for many years
All are heterotrophs and live as predators or parasites
Move and capture prey by putting out pseudopodia
Example of amoeboid protozoan

answer.Slime moulds in unfavourable conditions: Differentiate and form fruiting bodies bearing spores at their tips
answer.Slime mould spores: Extremely resistant and survive for many years
answer.Protozoans: All are heterotrophs and live as predators or parasites
answer.Amoeboid protozoans: Move and capture prey by putting out pseudopodia

question: Match the following:
columnB: Parasite
Have silica shells on their surface
Have flagella
Example of flagellated protozoan that causes sleeping sickness
Aquatic, actively moving organisms because of cilia

answer.Marine amoeboid protozoans: Have silica shells on their surface
answer.Trypanosoma: Example of flagellated protozoan that causes sleeping sickness
answer.Ciliated protozoans: Aquatic, actively moving organisms because of cilia

question: Match the following:
columnB: Cause coordinated movement to steer food into the gullet
Example: Paramoecium
Include organisms with infectious spore-like stage
Malarial parasite
Causes malaria

answer.Cilia in ciliated protozoans: Cause coordinated movement to steer food into the gullet
answer.Sporozoans: Include organisms with infectious spore-like stage
